intro: Cabralea eichleriana, commonly known as the Eichler's cabralea, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round, red fruits that are edible and often consumed by birds and small mammals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
